Actionality: Major tags are listed in line 2, their values, or sub-types (sub-tags) are listed in lines 2-17.
Possible problems for programming, or What to take into account:

Actuality: Pink color highlights all places where we have the value "Unspecified".
When the value is "Unspecified", the output should only name the major tag.
In other words, "Unspecified" shows that the tag named in line 1 is assigned to a certain construction, but this tag does not have any subtypes.
No subtypes can be given in the output, only the name of the major tag.
Note that sometimes the value "Unspecified" is not the only value in the list of sub-tags, but one value in an invenory of sub-tags (as in the case of major tag Concession - column Q).
Blue color marks those cases, where a single construction has two sub-tags listed within one major tag.
We use comma to separate these values.
Some sub-tags have a further specification separated with a colon ":" These cases are marked with purple color.
